title: High Above These HEAVENS
body_text:
One Crown. One Throne. One Torch .. One Man.
BACKGROUND INFORMATION
East Coast Dodgeball
CLASH OF THE TITANS
was the astounding 192nd event produced within the
Tronolone Era
. It was the 171st placed on a Saturday and began around 6:30PM.
CLASH OF THE TITANS will undoubtedly be remembered for the immediate relocation from the classic Wall High School battlegrounds to the original home of
ECD
,
Ocean Road Park
. This sudden change came from the unannounced reconstruction of the Wall High School courts, prompting a brief venue search by legendary figures Justin Wolf, Michael "Sputz" Krott, John Tronolone, and event captain Kevin Fitzpatrick.
As a result, in the extensive, multi-year history of
ECD
, CLASH OF THE TITANS became just the 23rd Ocean Road Park outing - a first since the
ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY
in September 2006!
MAIN ATTRACTION
Billed as the event name said, the feverishly-awaited encounter between iconic forces
Kevin Adams
and
Kevin Fitzpatrick
shook the very foundations of the Earth. In the epic collision believed by some of
ECD
's most devoted to once and for all crown the true "greatest",
Adams defeated Fitzpatrick
.
Adams' road to victory came rather smooth with both a strong supporting cast and impressive individual performance. Aside from several methodical eliminations on key adversaries, his terminations perpetrated against Fitzpatrick were crucial in the overall outcome. With the incomparable powerhouse out of commission, the Adams brigade was able to gradually pick apart the opposition.
Of the eight total contests, the initial six were hard-earned by Adams. Fitzpatrick, to his credit, began a successful counterattack to alter the momentum of the epic war. But time ticked away at the resurgence and eventually concluded the mighty clash.
Notable god-blessed combatants included the likes of the ultra-powerful Grant Cornero, the comedic but strategic Travis Mills, and the high-leaping battle cat Zach Katz.
SPECIAL OCCASION
They recited the words "I Do" on the unforgettable evening of May 19, 2012; on August 4, they said their heart-felt "goodbyes" to the entire
ECD
World.
Newlyweds
Chris and Joanice Adams
made their final appearance at an
East Coast Dodgeball
extravaganza. The near seven-year veteran and two-year sensation, respectively, received a deserving ovation from the remaining crowd as well as an authentic souvenir in appreciation of their dedication: one pair of prized captains armbands.
As the behind-the-scenes Writer, on behalf of everyone at
ECD
, I - John Tronolone - wish you both the best. You will be missed!
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
Both leading generals verbally agreed to the match the day of Chris and Joanice's wedding!
STATISTICAL SIGNIFICANCE
The attendance for the monumental CLASH OF THE TITANS was an impressive
twenty-three (23)
, an exceptional number considering the sudden location change.
Included in the turnout:
→ 22 men participated meaning that just 1 female was present - Joanice Lima.
→ Dell Cee, Hadjh Day, Jason Tyson, and Te Ed were the 4 new
ECD
players meaning that a grand total of 497 different people have competed throughout the legendary
Tronolone Years
.
August 4
became the first date to host three
ECD
spectaculars:
DODGEBALL 50
(2006),
DODGEBALL NINETY-NINE
(2007), and now CLASH OF THE TITANS (2012).
Captains’ Statistics
The K. Adams-Fitzpatrick bout witnessed Adams capture his record-setting 10th win handing Fitzpatrick just his fourth overall loss and his first since the memorable
CREAMation 3
against Chris Adams in September 2007.
Records stand at 10-3-0 (Adams) and 7-4-1 (Fitzpatrick).
________________________________________
___________________________
SEVEN: The Anniversary
Saturday, September 1, 2012
Wall High School*
*Subject to Change
body_html:
One Crown. One Throne. One Torch .. One Man.

  • BACKGROUND INFORMATION
    East Coast Dodgeball CLASH OF THE TITANS was the astounding 192nd event produced within the Tronolone Era. It was the 171st placed on a Saturday and began around 6:30PM.

    CLASH OF THE TITANS will undoubtedly be remembered for the immediate relocation from the classic Wall High School battlegrounds to the original home of ECD, Ocean Road Park. This sudden change came from the unannounced reconstruction of the Wall High School courts, prompting a brief venue search by legendary figures Justin Wolf, Michael "Sputz" Krott, John Tronolone, and event captain Kevin Fitzpatrick.

    As a result, in the extensive, multi-year history of ECD, CLASH OF THE TITANS became just the 23rd Ocean Road Park outing - a first since the ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY in September 2006!

  • MAIN ATTRACTION
    Billed as the event name said, the feverishly-awaited encounter between iconic forces Kevin Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick shook the very foundations of the Earth. In the epic collision believed by some of ECD's most devoted to once and for all crown the true "greatest", Adams defeated Fitzpatrick.

    Adams' road to victory came rather smooth with both a strong supporting cast and impressive individual performance. Aside from several methodical eliminations on key adversaries, his terminations perpetrated against Fitzpatrick were crucial in the overall outcome. With the incomparable powerhouse out of commission, the Adams brigade was able to gradually pick apart the opposition.

    Of the eight total contests, the initial six were hard-earned by Adams. Fitzpatrick, to his credit, began a successful counterattack to alter the momentum of the epic war. But time ticked away at the resurgence and eventually concluded the mighty clash.

    Notable god-blessed combatants included the likes of the ultra-powerful Grant Cornero, the comedic but strategic Travis Mills, and the high-leaping battle cat Zach Katz.

  • SPECIAL OCCASION
    They recited the words "I Do" on the unforgettable evening of May 19, 2012; on August 4, they said their heart-felt "goodbyes" to the entire ECD World.

    Newlyweds Chris and Joanice Adams made their final appearance at an East Coast Dodgeball extravaganza. The near seven-year veteran and two-year sensation, respectively, received a deserving ovation from the remaining crowd as well as an authentic souvenir in appreciation of their dedication: one pair of prized captains armbands.

    As the behind-the-scenes Writer, on behalf of everyone at ECD, I - John Tronolone - wish you both the best. You will be missed!

    ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
    Both leading generals verbally agreed to the match the day of Chris and Joanice's wedding!

  • STATISTICAL SIGNIFICANCE
    The attendance for the monumental CLASH OF THE TITANS was an impressive twenty-three (23), an exceptional number considering the sudden location change.

    Included in the turnout:
    → 22 men participated meaning that just 1 female was present - Joanice Lima.
    → Dell Cee, Hadjh Day, Jason Tyson, and Te Ed were the 4 new ECD players meaning that a grand total of 497 different people have competed throughout the legendary Tronolone Years.

    August 4 became the first date to host three ECD spectaculars: DODGEBALL 50 (2006), DODGEBALL NINETY-NINE (2007), and now CLASH OF THE TITANS (2012).

    Captains’ Statistics
    The K. Adams-Fitzpatrick bout witnessed Adams capture his record-setting 10th win handing Fitzpatrick just his fourth overall loss and his first since the memorable CREAMation 3 against Chris Adams in September 2007.

    Records stand at 10-3-0 (Adams) and 7-4-1 (Fitzpatrick).

    ___________________________________________________________________


    SEVEN: The Anniversary
    Saturday, September 1, 2012
    Wall High School*



    *Subject to Change
